intro: Phlomis cephalotes, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage and produces showy, purple or violet flower clusters at the ends of its branches. Its flowers are typically tubular and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phlomis cephalotes is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought-resistant characteristics.
